object.value: The pen is mightier than the sword.-Proverb
object.1: The leader of genius must have the ability to make different opponents appear as if they belonged to one category
object.2: If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!
object.3: If you tell a big enough lie and tell it frequently enough, it will be believed.
object.4: If you dont like a Rule... Just Follow it.. Reach on the Top.. and Change the Rule -Adolf Hitler
object.5: What luck, for governments, that the people are stupid! -Adolf Hitler
object.6: Terrorism is the best political weapon for nothing drives people harder than a fear of sudden death. -Adolf Hitler
object.7: When You Are In The Light, Everything Follows You, But When You Enter Into The Dark, Even Your Own Shadow -Doesn't Follow You.
object.8: Tell a lie loud enough and long enough and people will believe it.-Adolf Hitler
object.9: Life is like a game, there could be many players. If you don't play with them, they'll play with you.-Adolf Hitler
object.10: Let me control the textbooks, and I will control the state.-Adolf Hitler
object.11: It is better to make a mistake than to do nothing. -Adolf Hitler
object.12: A woman must be a cute, cuddly, naive little thing - tender, sweet, and stupid.-Adolf Hitler
object.13: Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas.-Joseph Stalin
object.14: It's not the people who vote that count. It's the people who count the votes.-Joseph Stalin
object.15: The death of one man is tragic, but the death of thousands is statistic.-Joseph Stalin
object.16: When there's a person, there's a problem. When there's no person, there's no problem.-Joseph Stalin
object.17: Great Britain provided time; the United States provided money and Soviet Russia provided blood.-Joseph Stalin
object.18: When we hang the capitalists they will sell us the rope we use. -Joseph Stalin
object.19: It is not heroes that make history, but history that makes heroes. -Joseph Stalin
object.20:
To choose one's victims, to prepare one's plan minutely, to slake an implacable vengeance, and then to go to bed... There is nothing sweeter in the world.
Joseph Stalin
object.21: If you’re going through hell, keep going.
object.22: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm
object.23: One always measures friendships by how they show up in bad weather.
object.24: You must look at facts, because they look at you.
object.25: So long as I'm the president, my measure of success is victory -- and success. -G.W.Bush
object.26: Without training, they lacked knowledge. Without knowledge, they lacked confidence. Without confidence, they lacked victory.-Julius Caesar
object.27: In the end, it is impossible not to become what others believe you are. -Julius Caesar
object.28: A coward dies a thousand deaths, the gallant never taste of death but once. -Julius Caesar
object.29: The greatest enemy will hide in the last place you would ever look. -Julius Caesar
object.30: “The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.― Isaac Asimov
object.31: “Never memorize something that you can look up. ― Albert Einstein
object.32: “If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?” ― Albert Einstein
object.33: Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.― Carl Sagan
object.34: That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence.― Christopher Hitchens
object.35: I don’t think of all the misery but of the beauty that still remains. Anne Frank
object.36: I’ve never seen a smiling face that was not beautiful. Unknown
object.37: Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened.― Dr. Seuss
object.38: God created war so that Americans would learn geography.― Mark Twain
object.39: War is what happens when language fails.― Margaret Atwood
object.40: Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.― Herbert Hoover
object.41: Only the dead have seen the end of war.― Plato
object.42: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.― Sun Tzu, The Art of War
object.43: If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!― Adolf Hitler
object.44: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.― Linus Torvalds
object.45: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.― Martin Fowler
object.46: That's the thing about people who think they hate computers. What they really hate is lousy programmers.― Larry Niven
object.47: You've baked a really lovely cake, but then you've used dog shit for frosting.― Steve Jobs
object.48: The computing scientist’s main challenge is not to get confused by the complexities of his own making. — E. W. Dijkstra
object.49: One of my most productive days was throwing away 1000 lines of code.— Ken Thompson
object.50: Violence is the last resort of the incompetent.— Isaac Asimov.
object.51: An Eye for an Eye will make the whole world blind.— Gandhi
object.52: Only the dead have seen the end of war.-Plato
object.53: HOMEOPATHY: turning water into money since 1810— Dr Aust
object.54: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself - and you are the easiest person to fool. — Richard Feynman,
object.55: It is the responsibility of every citizen to ignore dumb laws.— Ian Clarke
object.56: Revolution is the opium of the intellectuals — Jerzy Peterkiewicz
object.57: Politics on the internet, it’s like jupiter’s great red spot, except made of feces.-cutsDwnSudoIntelects
object.58: The more we love our friends, the less we flatter them; it is by excusing nothing that pure love shows itself. — Moliere
object.59: True friends stab you in the front.— Oscar Wilde
object.61: I can’t give you a brain, but I can give you a diploma.— L. Frank Baum
object.62: Men are born ignorant, not stupid. They are made stupid by education.— Bertrand Russell
object.63: We’ve not been to school. We are using our minds.— Unknown
object.64: Never let your schooling interfere with your education.— Mark Twain
object.65: A study of economics usually reveals that the best time to buy anything is last year.— Marty Allen
object.66: Economic statistics are like a bikini, what they reveal is important, what they conceal is vital — Attributed to Professor Sir Frank Holmes
object.67: Doing econometrics is like trying to learn the laws of electricity by playing the radio.— Guy Orcutt
object.68: The biggest secret to winning in the marketplace is choosing very incompetent competitors.— Bram Cohen
object.69: Good artists copy; great artists steal.— Pablo Picasso
object.70: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.-Friedrich Nietzsche
object.71: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.-Albert Einstein
object.72: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.-Mahatma Gandhi
object.73: If you want something done right, do it yourself.-Charles-Guillaume Étienne
object.74: The unexamined life is not worth living. -Socrates
object.75: Better to have loved and lost, than to have never loved at all.-St Augustine
object.76: Necessity is the mother of invention.-Plato
object.77: Imagination is more important than knowledge.-Albert Einstein
object.78: ive a man a fish and you feed him for a day; teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.-Proverb
object.79: With great power comes great responsibility.-Voltaire
object.80: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.-Theodore Roosevelt
object.81: Life is like a box of chocolates. You never know what you’re gonna get.-Forrest Gump’s Mom
object.83: Leadership and learning are indispensable to each other.-John F. Kennedy
object.84: The ballot is stronger than the bullet.-Lincoln
object.85: Whether you think you can or think you can’t – you are right.-Henry Ford
object.86: A rose by any other name would smell as sweet.-Juliet
object.87: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.-Albert Einstein
object.88: A penny saved is a penny earned.-Benjamin Franklin
object.91: Without music, life would be a mistake.-Friedrich Nietzsche
object.92: Go to heaven for the climate and hell for the company.-Mark Twain
object.93: You can’t always get what you want.-The Rolling Stones
object.94: Dream as if you’ll live forever. Live as if you’ll die today.
object.95: If at first you don’t succeed, try, try, try again.-William Edward Hickson
object.97: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.-Mae West
object.98: Hell has no fury like a woman scorned.-William Congreve
